results.title: Liposomal simvastatin sensitizes C26 murine colon carcinoma to the antitumor effects of liposomal 5-fluorouracil in vivo
results.text_hl: Liposomal @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ sensitizes @CELLLINE_CVCL:0507 @@@C26@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@murine@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Colonic_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003110 @@@colon carcinoma@@@ to the antitumor effects of liposomal @CHEMICAL_Fluorouracil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005472 @@@5-fluorouracil@@@ in vivo

results.title: Descriptive Proteome Analysis to Investigate Context-Dependent Treatment Responses to OXPHOS Inhibition in Colon Carcinoma Cells Grown as Monolayer and Multicellular Tumor Spheroids
results.text_hl: @CELLLINE_CVCL:0291 @@@HCT116@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Colonic_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003110 @@@colon carcinoma@@@ cells were cultured as monolayer cultures, proliferative multicellular @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ spheroids (P-@DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@MCTS@@@), or quiescent (Q-@DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@MCTS@@@) multicellular @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ spheroids and exposed to OXPHOS inhibitors: @CHEMICAL_nitazoxanide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C041747 @@@nitazoxanide@@@, @CHEMICAL_Carbonyl_Cyanide_p_Trifluoromethoxyphenylhydrazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002259 @@@FCCP@@@, @CHEMICAL_Oligomycins @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009840 @@@oligomycin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_salinomycin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C010327 @@@salinomycin@@@ or the @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@HMG-CoA-reductase@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ at two different doses for 6 and 24 h.

citations.NLM: Steinmetz J, Senkowski W, Lengqvist J, Rubin J, Ossipova E, Herman S, Larsson R, Jakobsson PJ, Fryknäs M, Kultima K. Descriptive Proteome Analysis to Investigate Context-Dependent Treatment Responses to OXPHOS Inhibition in Colon Carcinoma Cells Grown as Monolayer and Multicellular Tumor Spheroids ACS Omega. 2020 Jul 21;5(28):17242-17254. PMID: 32715210

results.title: Prevention of 1,2-dimethylhydrazine-induced colon tumorigenesis by HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors, pravastatin and simvastatin, in ICR mice.
results.text_hl: The incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Colonic_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003110 @@@colon tumors@@@ examined at weeks 25 or 30 was reduced by 67% in the 0.01% @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@Pr@@@ group, by 30% in the 0.005% @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@Pr@@@ and 0.01% @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Si@@@ groups, and by 24% in the 0.001% @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@Pr@@@ and 0.002% @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Si@@@ groups, compared with their respective controls.

citations.NLM: Narisawa T, Fukaura Y, Terada K, Umezawa A, Tanida N, Yazawa K, Ishikawa C. Prevention of 1,2-dimethylhydrazine-induced colon tumorigenesis by HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors, pravastatin and simvastatin, in ICR mice. Carcinogenesis. 1994 Sep;15(9):2045-8. PMID: 7923600
citations.BibTeX: @article{7923600, title={Prevention of 1,2-dimethylhydrazine-induced colon tumorigenesis by HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors, pravastatin and simvastatin, in ICR mice.}, author={Narisawa T and Fukaura Y and Terada K and Umezawa A and Tanida N and Yazawa K and Ishikawa C}, journal={Carcinogenesis}, volume={15}, number={9}, pages={2045-8}}

results.title: MDR reversal and pro-apoptotic effects of statins and statins combined with flavonoids in colon cancer cells.
results.text_hl: In this work it was shown that statins - @CHEMICAL_mevastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C012258 @@@mevastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ exert antiproliferative, pro-apoptotic and reversing drug resistance effect in @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Colonic_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003110 @@@colon adenocarcinoma@@@ cell line @CELLLINE_CVCL:0399 @@@LoVo@@@ and its drug-resistant subline @CELLLINE_CVCL:0399 @@@LoVo/Dx@@@.

citations.NLM: Palko-Łabuz A, Środa-Pomianek K, Wesołowska O, Kostrzewa-Susłow E, Uryga A, Michalak K. MDR reversal and pro-apoptotic effects of statins and statins combined with flavonoids in colon cancer cells. Biomed Pharmacother. 2019 Jan;109():1511-1522. PMID: 30551403
